headline.main: LONDON.; Independence Day in the British Capital--The American Association, Suggested by the New-York Times The Speech of Mr. Dallas--Lord John Russell-John Bright--A fele at Cremothe Gardens

docs.lead_paragraph: Two remarkable fetes, equally exclusive, perhaps, in character, but in all other respects most dissimilar, mark the history of the current week in London. We began on the 5th with a flaming celebration of the Fourth of July, by an association of "successful rebels" in the capital of the grand daughter of GEORGE III., and under the very eyes of a counterfeit presentment of that gracious princess.

docs.snippet: REFRESHING WEATHER.--We are now in the enjoyment of all the comforts of the season, so far as the weather is concerned. What more could reasonably be looked for in July than a bright sun, unclouded skies and a temperature cool as may consist with...
docs.lead_paragraph: REFRESHING WEATHER.--We are now in the enjoyment of all the comforts of the season, so far as the weather is concerned. What more could reasonably be looked for in July than a bright sun, unclouded skies and a temperature cool as may consist with perfeet comfort ? For more than a week this delightful weather has uninterruptedly prevailed. The storms which afflicted other localities passed us by.

docs.snippet: The Board of Councilmen met Friday evening the President, C. H. HAHWELL, Esq., in the Chair. A petition was presented for the rebuilding and extension of Pier No. 51, North River. Another, asking that Astor-place, from That to Fourth avennes, might...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Councilmen met Friday evening the President, C. H. HAHWELL, Esq., in the Chair. A petition was presented for the rebuilding and extension of Pier No. 51, North River. Another, asking that Astor-place, from That to Fourth avennes, might be paved with Relgian pavement. A resolution was adopted authorizing the Central Park Commissioners the receive the manure from the various dumping boards on the East River.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Coroner's Inquests. Reasons for Removal. Mayor's Office.

docs.lead_paragraph: A MOTHER AND HER CHILD BURNED TO DEATH. --Corner PERRY an inquest Saturday, at the comer of Forto-first-street and Eighth avenue, upon the bodies of Mrs. THOMAS RYAN and her daughter ELLEN RYAN, 9 years of age, who died from ourns. The mother used some camphene to start the fire, and the flames extended to the can containing camphene, an explosion, scattering the contents over ner clothing and enveloping her in flames. es.

docs.snippet: The City Physician of Boston in his last report says: "I have only to report a single death from Smallpox during the year, and there is good reason to hope that for the future the disease will never again prevail to any extent in our city, so long as...
docs.lead_paragraph: The City Physician of Boston in his last report says: "I have only to report a single death from Smallpox during the year, and there is good reason to hope that for the future the disease will never again prevail to any extent in our city, so long as vaccination is attended to so generally by the profession and the people themselves."

docs.snippet: The Canadian screw-steamer Indian arrived at Quebec, from Liverpool, on Saturday afternoon. Her news is to the 14th inst. The most interesting item is the return of the Agamemnon to Cork, and the renewal of the attempt to lay the telegraphic cable....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Canadian screw-steamer Indian arrived at Quebec, from Liverpool, on Saturday afternoon. Her news is to the 14th inst. The most interesting item is the return of the Agamemnon to Cork, and the renewal of the attempt to lay the telegraphic cable. The squadron was expected to sail for the mid-ocean station on the 17th.

docs.snippet: QUARANTINE AFFAIRS.--The bark Harmon. Captain Wood, from Mantanzas, with sugar, having four passenger; brig Loano, GIBBS, from Remedios. with sugar, and one passenger, and the clipper ship Swallow, TUCKER, from Havana, in ballast, with two...
docs.lead_paragraph: QUARANTINE AFFAIRS.--The bark Harmon. Captain Wood, from Mantanzas, with sugar, having four passenger; brig Loano, GIBBS, from Remedios. with sugar, and one passenger, and the clipper ship Swallow, TUCKER, from Havana, in ballast, with two passengers, arrived in the lower anchorage yesterday. The two former report all well on board and having had tine weather during the passage.

docs.snippet: The United States sloop-of-war Savannah went in commission on Thursday, at 12 O'clock. Her crew, consisting of two hundred and thirty men, were taken from then receiving ship North Carolina. Her marine guard number 43 men, A. J. HAYS, Commander, and...

headline.main: Naval Intelligence. The United States sloop-of-war Savannah....Engineers for the Navy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States sloop-of-war Savannah went in commission on Thursday, at 12 O'clock. Her crew, consisting of two hundred and thirty men, were taken from then receiving ship North Carolina. Her marine guard number 43 men, A. J. HAYS, Commander, and will sail for the West Indies about the 1st of August. she now lies in the stream. The U.S. steamer Arctic, from key West, arrived at Washington on Saturday morning.

docs.snippet: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--At the meeting of the Commissioners of Health on Friday, the following communication from the Health Officer was received, and its suggestions were adopted. The Commission then adjourned.
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--At the meeting of the Commissioners of Health on Friday, the following communication from the Health Officer was received, and its suggestions were adopted. The Commission then adjourned.

docs.snippet: BOUND FOR THE COUNTRY.-The cars and steamboats which leave New-York daily, connecting with all parts of the country, distant and near at hand, are crowded to overflowing with individuals setting out for health and pleasure excursions into the rural...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOUND FOR THE COUNTRY.-The cars and steamboats which leave New-York daily, connecting with all parts of the country, distant and near at hand, are crowded to overflowing with individuals setting out for health and pleasure excursions into the rural districts. In the gray of the early morning.
